## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, but I'm not really sure what it is or how it works. Can you explain it to me?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform where you can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs directly on the blockchain. You can advertise your offer to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post it publicly for anyone to see. Transactions are executed peer-to-peer, without intermediaries, and can be done using transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. How does the marketplace allow for value-added agents or marketing organizations to participate in the transaction process?

**AI Assistant:**
Although the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace operates in a decentralized manner, it still allows owners to select and share proceeds with value-added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in the digital ownership economy. This enables a new economy of provable digital ownership. It's a way for creators and owners to benefit from their digital assets, while still maintaining control and decentralization.

**User:**
I've also heard about Verus Vault. What is it, and how does it protect funds on a VerusID?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus Vault is a feature that allows you to lock your VerusID, protecting funds from theft even if your private key is compromised. While locked, you cannot spend funds from that identity, but you can still stake those funds on the Verus network and earn rewards. You can also still receive funds. It's an additional layer of security for your digital assets.

**User:**
That's great to know. What are the requirements for enabling revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID?

**AI Assistant:**
To enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID, you need to have at least one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. This allows you to have full control over your digital identity and assets, while still maintaining the security and flexibility of the Verus ecosystem.
What is the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and how does it work?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform where you can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs directly on the blockchain. You can advertise your offer to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post it publicly for anyone to see. Transactions are executed peer-to-peer, without intermediaries, and can be done using transparent or zero-knowledge private addresses.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
